description.narrative: Reinforce security sector accountability through enhanced oversight mechanisms : Control mechanism, Capacity general inspections, Autonomy general inspections

participating-org.narrative: US International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

provider-org.narrative: US International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs
US International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

description.narrative: Ind 1.1 Number of oversight mechanisms developed. Target: 2 mechanisms developed (1 referential document on MoI internal oversight department’ missions and responsibilities and 1 referential document of MoI internal oversight inspectors’ functions and competencies) Ind 1.2 A new code of conduct targeting the MoI general inspectors developed. Target: Code of conduct developed Ind. 1.3 - 2 guides developed. Target = 2 (an internal control SOPs guide and a guide on disciplinary protocols) Ind.1.4 Number of members of general inspections receiving capacity strengthening on general inspectors’ code of conduct. Target = 100 (Men/women) Ind 2.1 Number of members of general inspection services trained in strategic planification, management, budget, HR, human rights, anticorruption, rule of law…). Target = 160 (men/women) Ind. 2.2 Level of institutionalization of the TOT team operating mode Target: Operation mode of the ToT team institutionalized (0= N/A, 1= manual of TOT developed, 2=TOT team operational) Ind 3.1 Status of the MoI general inspectors defined. Target = Job descriptions for MoI general inspectors drafted Ind 3.2 Number of MoI general inspectors receiving capacity strengthening on inspectors’ status (Men/women) Target = 80 Ind 3.3 Level of decentralization of the general inspection services. Target = 3 plan of action operational (0 = Not existent, 1= delimitation of competencies, 2= draft legal framework on decentralization developed, 3 = Draft plan of action developed, 4= implementation of the action plan) Ind 3.4 Level of development of a RBM tool. Target = 100% Ind 3.5 Number of members of general inspectors receiving capacity strengthening in RBM and IT tools (Results-Based Programming, Budgeting, Management, Monitoring and Reporting). Target = 80 (M/W) Ind 4.1 Number of beneficiaries receiving capacity strengthening through coordination workshops between the parliamentary committees and the MoI (M/W) Target : 100 (50 MP/ 50 MoI staff membe

comment.narrative: Ind 1.1 Number of oversight mechanisms developed. Baseline: N/A Ind 1.2 A new code of conduct targeting the MoI general inspectors developed. Baseline: 0% Ind. 1.3 - 2 guides developed. Baseline: 0 Ind.1.4 Number of members of general inspections receiving capacity strengthening on general inspectors’ code of conduct. Baseline: 0 Ind 2.1 Number of members of general inspection services trained in strategic planification, management, budget, HR, human rights, anticorruption, rule of law…). Baseline: 0 Ind. 2.2 Level of institutionalization of the TOT team operating mode Baseline: 0 Ind 3.1 Status of the MoI general inspectors defined. Baseline: 0% Ind 3.2 Number of MoI general inspectors receiving capacity strengthening on inspectors’ status (Men/women) Baseline: 0 Ind 3.3 Level of decentralization of the general inspection services. Baseline: 0 Ind 3.4 Level of development of a RBM tool. Baseline: 0% Ind 3.5 Number of members of general inspectors receiving capacity strengthening in RBM and IT tools (Results-Based Programming, Budgeting, Management, Monitoring and Reporting). Baseline: 0 Ind 4.1 Number of beneficiaries receiving capacity strengthening through coordination workshops between the parliamentary committees and the MoI (M/W) Baseline: 0 Ind 4.2 Citizens complaints mechanism is operational. Baseline: 0 Ind 4.3 Number of ISF participants in training sessions for MoI representatives on the national general control committees oversight mechanisms and missions. Baseline: 0 Ind 4.4 ISF judicial investigators control mechanism by the judicial authorities is developed (0 = N/A, 1= control mechanism discussed between ISF and judicial authorities representatives, 2 = judicial control mechanism drafted) Baseline: 0 Ind 4.5 Number of ISF participants in concertation workshops including juridical and ISF representatives in order to promote the quality of judicial investigations procedures Baseline: 0

Ind 1.1 Number of oversight mechanisms developed. Target: 50% Ind 1.2 A new code of conduct targeting the MoI general inspectors developed. Target: 50% Ind. 1.3 - 2 guides developed. Target = 1 (an internal control SOPs guide and a guide on disciplinary protocols) Ind.1.4 Number of members of general inspections receiving capacity strengthening on general inspectors’ code of conduct. Target = 50 (Men/women) Ind 2.1 Number of members of general inspection services trained in strategic planification, management, budget, HR, human rights, anticorruption, rule of law…). Target = 80 (men/women) Ind. 2.2 Level of institutionalization of the TOT team operating mode Target: 1= manual of TOT developed Ind 3.1 Status of the MoI general inspectors defined. Target = 50% Job descriptions for MoI general inspectors drafted Ind 3.2 Number of MoI general inspectors receiving capacity strengthening on inspectors’ status (Men/women) Target = 40 Ind 3.3 Level of decentralization of the general inspection services. Target = 3 plan of action operational draft legal framework on decentralization developed, Ind 3.4 Level of development of a RBM tool. Target = 50% Ind 3.5 Number of members of general inspectors receiving capacity strengthening in RBM and IT tools (Results-Based Programming, Budgeting, Management, Monitoring and Reporting). Target = 40 (M/W) Ind 4.1 Number of beneficiaries receiving capacity strengthening through coordination workshops between the parliamentary committees and the MoI (M/W) Target : 50 (50 MP/ 50 MoI staff members) Ind 4.2 Citizens complaints mechanism is operational. Target = 1 mechanism operational 1= complaints mechanism developed & tested, Ind 4.3 Number of ISF participants in training sessions for MoI representatives on the national general control committees oversight mechanisms and missions. Target: 80 Ind 4.4 ISF judicial investigators control mechanism by the judicial authorities is developed (0 = N/A, 1= control mechanism discussed between ISF and judicial authorities representatives, 2 = judicial control mechanism drafted) Target: 1 Ind 4.5 Number of ISF participants in concertation workshops including juridical and ISF representatives in order to promote the quality of judicial investigations procedures Target : 50
Not Applicable, Project started effectivley in 2021.
